N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 35.6 - Performance rating board

State Regulations
(a) The

Performance Rating Board of an agency shall consist of not less than three nor
more than five members who shall be employees of the agency with permanent
status, at least two of whom shall be in the competitive class. The agency head
shall appoint the members of the Performance Rating Board or, if he so
authorizes, they may be elected by the employees of the agency for a term
specified by the agency head. In a large agency, separate boards may be
designated for geographically-separated units, districts or
institutions. (b) As directed by
the agency head, the Performance Rating Board in each agency shall
(1)
develop and administer procedures for the
appeal of performance ratings; (2)
allow any employee to appeal from an unsatisfactory performance rating, review
the appeal, and inform the employee of its decision. In the case of an
unsatisfactory rating where the appeal is denied, the board shall notify the
employee of his right to appeal his unsatisfactory rating to the Civil Service

Commission. Notes
